TopicTitle: What does the new precooler do?

Articles.Content: Is it just an intake with a fuel tank, or is it something more?
It's a remodeled intake. Probably with the new thermal system it might actually reduce heat on the attached engines.
It sucks in air radially and makes your engines perform better, but I'm not sure exactly how.
I want to know this too.

Actually its the same as the nacelle, except that it has better emissive coefficient. Basically it can dump heat away faster than standard nacelle.

Hmm, looking at cfg files, it seems nuclear engine has emmisivity of 0.85 while this precooler has 0.95... Folks, this is something to attach a nuclear engine to. For vacuum uses ofc.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T23:27:51Z" title="04/27/2015 11:27  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by Radam**
Might be good to attach a drill to also. would help keep drills cool??

> 
> I want to know this too.

Are you asking about the physics or how to use this part in particular?

Just to avoid confusion from a resources standpoint, adding a precooler isn't going to change performance of the engines or IntakeAir system.

Cheers,

~Claw
